concept.title: Release Notes
concept.shortdesc: This library is intended for application developers for the Symbian^3 platform.

section.title: Major changes between the week 03 2010 release and week 12 2010 release
section.p: Since the week 03 2010 documentation submission to the Symbian Foundation, the following major additions have been made:

li.p: Inclusion of API reference extracted from the Symbian^3 source code.
A new About Symbian^3 topic, including What's new and Porting applications from S60 5th Edition to Symbian^3.
A new Getting Started, consisting of the Symbian Foundation's C++ Quick Start and Going Beyond Hello tutorials.
Integration of the Panic Codes Reference.
Addition of new topics: Common Email Guide and System Resource Monitoring.
The Graphics Guide has been updated for Symbian^3. For details, see What's New in Graphics in Symbian^3.
The Classic UI Guide has been updated for Symbian^3.
All guides have been updated to refer to the Symbian platform rather than to Symbian OS and to S60, apart from where it is necessary to refer to past releases.

section.p: This release contains fixes for the following bugs:

p.xref: Change section headings in Symbian^3 product/app reference
Fix up the links in the Platform security architecture page
Link to sample chapter of quick recipes book in SDK docs
Remove references to SDN and SDN++ from Symbian Developer Library

section.title: Major changes between the week 43 2009 release and week 03 2010 release
section.p: The following S60 5th Edition C++ Developer's Library 'Technology area guides' have been integrated into the Symbian guide:

li.p: Application and UI frameworks is now in Classic UI Guide.
S60 UI components is now in Classic UI Guide.
Multimedia is now in Multimedia Guide.
Browsing and downloading is now in Web Guide.
Location is now in Location Based Services (LBS).
Security is now found at the top level.

section.p: The S60 Open C and Open C++ documentation has been merged into the Symbian P.I.P.S. documentation and is now in Generic OS Services Guide.
The Symbian Developer Library for Application Developers is released under the Eclipse Public License (EPL).

section.title: Upcoming releases and improvements in the Symbian Developer Library for Application Developers
section.p: See the Documentation Content Package Backlog.

section.title: Feedback
section.p: To give feedback, please go to the Symbian Foundation Bugtracker (login required).
